alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Harding County; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 13 at 2:44PM MST until December 15 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches, except between 12 and 20 inches above 8,500 feet. Locally higher amounts up to 26 inches are possible on high peaks and ridges in the southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. Total snow accumulations in the Sandia/Manzano Mountains between 4 and 8 inches, except 8 to 12 inches above 8,500 feet. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast New Mexico. * WHEN...Until 2 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact this evening and Thursday morning commutes. This includes portions of the I-25 corridor from Glorieta Pass to Raton Pass, and the I-40 corridor through Tijeras Canyon. The weight of heavy wet snow may lead to power outages from broken tree limbs and downed power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
